sense.name: obscure with mist
sense.commentary: Includes: MIST_UP Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate]] MIST (up) NP2[destination] (PP[theme]) NP1[agent[animate]] MIST (over) NP2[destination] (PP[theme]) NP1[theme] MIST (over) NP2[destination]] NP1[theme] MIST (up) NP2[destination] NP1[destination] MIST (up) (PP[theme]) NP1[destination] MIST (over) (PP[theme])
sense.examples: The dental mirror misted. The glass misted with his exhalation. The glass misted from the heat of my palm. The window in the Cafe Des Amatuers misted over from the heat and smoke inside. But our vision seems to get dim as minutes pass, as if the window misted up. His breath briefly misted the glass. My warm breath misted up the glass. Perspiration had misted over the glass of my suit. A grey English drizzle misted the glass. Tears misted the old gentleman's eyes. I misted the glass with a sigh. Harry let out a long breath and watched as he misted up the window.

sense.name: spray with a mist of something
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate]] MIST NP2[destination] (PP[theme]) NP1[theme] MIST NP2[destination] NP1[destination] MIST PP[theme]
sense.examples: I misted the glass with dull coat. He misted the glass with a good amount of vermouth before pouring in the gin. I misted the entire card with Old Lace. After doing this, I misted the plants again. Perfume misted the air. The air misted with the scent of gardenias.

sense.name: weather condition
sense.commentary: Note: Includes an empty "it" subject. Syntax includes: MIST
sense.examples: It's misting outside. It misted on us once in the afternoon. It misted on us all day, and we nearly froze. It misted on campus and then froze. It misted on the drive up, and rainbows were plentiful.
